text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

text: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
author: Grady Booch

text: The Internet is becoming the town square for the global village of tomorrow.
author: Bill Gates

text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

text: The most dangerous phrase in the language is, 'We've always done it this way.'
author: Grace Hopper

text: The best way to get a project done faster is to start sooner.
author: Jim Highsmith

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Technology is nothing. What's important is that you have faith in people, that they're basically good and smart, and if you give them tools, they'll do wonderful things with them.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The advance of technology is based on making it fit in so that you don't really even notice it, so it's part of everyday life.
author: Bill Gates

text: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

text: The computer is incredibly fast, accurate, and stupid. Man is unbelievably slow, inaccurate, and brilliant. The marriage of the two is a force beyond calculation.
author: Leo Cherne

text: The question of whether computers can think is like the question of whether submarines can swim.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

text: The best performance improvement is the transition from the nonworking state to the working state.
author: John Ousterhout

text: The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds new discoveries, is not 'Eureka!' but 'That's funny...'
author: Isaac Asimov

text: The art of programming is the art of organizing complexity.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
